pullRequest.body:
The performance consequences are quite low (+0.2% instructions), this removes 12 adaptation notes, and most importantly this removes a weird behavior, which is hard to understand or debug when it creates problems.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

Zulip discussion at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/set_option.20maxSynthPendingDepth.202/near/499579408

Current commit [913169ddbd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/913169ddbdfea3f41a1c0e61929a361bc26ac175)
Reference commit [1a2cf02a13](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/1a2cf02a137bf557df31960226ddd8110c280c9c)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a7397931-88ae-44cf-800b-0144b94c655e) for commit 468c630b52cc868769af17a3ab6bc2143f0f55af.

[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13343516809)

I think it would be nice to provide a collection of instances / situations which require `maxSynthPendingDepth 2` (or possibly higher). I would like to have a test file that shows they fail at depth 1. That way if things change (even for the better), we know about it, instead of being left in the dark.
I would like to see other values tested before we settle on `2` or any other number.
I would like to see other values tested before we settle on `2` or any other number.
Is this just performance or does `simp` now fail?
`simp` now fails, because it becomes able to apply `algebraMap_smul` (it couldn't before, because it couldn't synthetize some instance), and applying it sends it on a wrong track.
I think this is the only change that gives me pause here.
Yes, that's bad. But these files are bad (because of universe issues, for instance), so maybe making these files better would wash this away.

pullRequest.title: chore: set maxSynthPending to 2

[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13343516809)
I would like to see other values tested before we settle on `2` or any other number.

I think it would be nice to provide a collection of instances / situations which require `maxSynthPendingDepth 2` (or possibly higher). I would like to have a test file that shows they fail at depth 1. That way if things change (even for the better), we know about it, instead of being left in the dark.
